title: Finding a
text: First, we must factor by grouping to find a.

title: Factor by Grouping
text: What is the GCF between $$2x^2$$ and $$-12x$$?

title: Factor by Grouping
text: Since the GCF is $$2$$, we factor both terms by $$2$$ and now have (2*((x**2)-(6*x))+7.

title: Completing the Square
text: We must complete the square to rewrite the equation in the $$a {\left(x+b\right)}^2+k$$ form.

title: Completing the Square
text: First, we divide the second term of the polynomial by $$2$$, which in this case is $$-3$$, since $$\frac{-6}{2}$$ is $$-3$$.

title: Completing the Square
text: Next, we square term we got from dividing and add it inside of the polynomial, which in this case is $$9$$, since $${\left(-3\right)}^2$$ is $$9$$.

title: Completing the Square
text: After this, we notice that we can't just add in a $$9$$, so we subtract $$18$$ from our total equation outside of the parentheses, since a is $$2$$ and $$2\times9$$ is $$18$$.

title: Completing the Square
text: Finally, we simplify our polynomial to $$2{\left(x-3\right)}^2-11$$.
